channel.title: Sea fishing
channel.description:
So do any of you do any fishing? My friends and I recently got in to fishing just randomly, we live by the sea so we thought why not go for it. My uncle gave me a rod and a reel.
All I've done so far is fish with feathers and a weight on my line and I've caught 8 mackerel in 2 trips, we usually fish off a pier.
I mainly wanted to ask about catching other fish with bait, what line setup should I use? I filleted a mackerel and used strips of it as bait but didn't get anything from that (I used 3 hooks with a weight).
I also ate what I caught yesterday, I felt rather manly. So another thing I want to know(if you have experience) is what is the best way to cook mackerel fillets?

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

I used to go with my dad between Ilfracombe and Combe martin in north devon, We used to be able to go to a spot and with a trace of 5 feathers on one line you could drop the line and within 5 min you’d have a full line of mackeral… We caught over 50 mackeral in an hour before.

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Don’t bother renting a boat…I’m sure one of your friends must have a cottage or something and a small aluminum boat you could fish off of…

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

thepinksock:

I don’t know, fishing is just a little hobby of mine now, I wouldn’t want to go balls deep and rent a boat, let alone buy one.

Just try things out yourself, different bait etc, try different places if possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

If you want to go fishing, get a boat or rent one. I sometimes go fishing with my dad and his friend. They usually go out on his wilson flyer. It’s an epic thing. They went fishing on sunday… Couldn’t catch anything but fucking mackerel. Once you find mackerel they won’t stop comming . They also caught some breme, couple of bass, rass, doggys(taste epic) and some others that had to be put back.

Whats wrong with a pier? Is using mackerel fillets not good bait?
Mackerel is sometimes good bait, depends what you are fishing for. Ragworm are pretty cool as well. The open sea is better if you can get out there. More fish!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Dem pikes are fun to catch and we be going to catch 'em this evening

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:14, topic:352762”]I used to be quite a heavy fisher, but mainly on ponds and rivers for Carp, bream, Barbel, Trout, Rudd, etc. I didn’t eat of any of that, was all for sport. But I have been sea fishing once or twice and caught a few mackerel which we then decided to cook…[/quote]Carp fishing is orssm and mad hardcore pro yo

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

I fish with a hand-line using bait, its probably the same as with a rod but a bit harder to land the fish.

Get on a boat and go to deeper waters to get stuff other then mackerel. Try not to get any of your smell on the line or bait, wash your hands before you go and stuff like that. Don’t jump around or shout on the boat as the fish would hear it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I used to be quite a heavy fisher, but mainly on ponds and rivers for Carp, bream, Barbel, Trout, Rudd, etc. I didn’t eat of any of that, was all for sport. But I have been sea fishing once or twice and caught a few mackerel which we then decided to cook…

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

ive actually gone fishing before irl at cottages, i used corn and bread and worms. worms work the best, i only caught small fish though. one time there was this footlong fish and it broke my fishing line.

Read full topic

find a good group and try it out, i learned a lot about fishing that way.

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

goatee:

Nah, wrap your mackerels in foil and grill them.

thats what i did, i sprinkled salt and pepper on the fillets then put some oil on them then put them in the oven for 10 minutes(wrapped in foil) at like 230C and it just tasted bland so I was thinking I need some herbs or some shit yo’.

Cowie`:

Unfortunately off the pier all you’re really going to get is mackerel unless you try maybe Lugworm, Ragworm or Peeler Crabs - Rent a boat for the day and go try your luck.

Whats wrong with a pier? Is using mackerel fillets not good bait?

Read full topic

item.title: Sea fishing
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Depends on volume of mackerels really, I personally love a stew with mackerel and a few muscles.

Unfortunately off the pier all you’re really going to get is mackerel unless you try maybe Lugworm, Ragworm or Peeler Crabs - Rent a boat for the day and go try your luck.

Read full topic
